title: Inter - Diffusion Generation Model of Speakers and Listeners for Effective Communication
author: Jinhe Huang (Nanjing Agriculture University), Gaoge Han (City University of Hong Kong), Yongkang Cheng (Nanjing Agriculture University), Jinwei Li (University of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Minghang Yu (Northwest A&F University), Jing Zhang (University of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Shilei Wang (Northwestern Polytechnical University), ..., Xingjian Gu (Nanjing Agriculture University)
relevance_why: The paper offers insights into gesture generation, which can be related to human-level audio interaction, making it relevant for enhancing multimodal audio generation systems that integrate gestures with speech.
background: Generating full-body gestures for both speakers and listeners during communication to enhance interaction realism in virtual settings.
contribution: This paper introduces the Inter-Diffusion Generation Model to solve the gap in listener gesture generation, achieving improved gesture naturalness and synchronization with speech.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focused mainly on speaker gesture generation, ignoring listener interactions, which limits realism in virtual communication.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by integrating listener gestures into a joint generation framework, allowing dynamic interaction and context-aware generation based on dialogue flow.

key_innovation: Incorporates gesture generation for both speakers and listeners using a novel inter-diffusion mechanism for enhanced interaction realism.
real_world_impact: This model has potential applications in fields like virtual reality, gaming, and film, creating more immersive user experiences by simulating realistic human interactions.
limitations: The model's reliance on traditional Markov-chain-based diffusion could hinder real-time application performance.

new_terms.Inter-Diffusion Generation Model: **Inter-Diffusion Generation Model** is a framework that simultaneously generates gestures for speakers and listeners by capturing their interactive dynamics during communication.
new_terms.Fr\u00e9chet Gesture Distance (FGD): **Fréchet Gesture Distance** is a metric used to quantify the similarity between generated gestures and real-world gestures by measuring the distance between their latent feature distributions.
